# Weex Client Documentation

Welcome to Weex Client documentation! This is a modern async-first Weex API client for Python 3.14+.

## Quick Start

```python import asyncio from weex_client import WeexAsyncClient, WeexConfig

async def main():

# Configure the client config = WeexConfig(

api_key=”your_api_key”, secret_key=”your_secret_key”, passphrase=”your_passphrase”, environment=”development”

)

# Use async context manager async with WeexAsyncClient(config) as client:

# Get account balance balance = await client.get_account_balance() print(f”Balance: {balance}”)

# Place an order from weex_client.models import PlaceOrderRequest order = PlaceOrderRequest(

symbol=”BTCUSDT”, client_oid=”my_order_001”, size=”0.001”, type=”1”, order_type=”1”, match_price=”0”, price=”50000.0”

)

result = await client.place_order(order) print(f”Order placed: {result}”)

if __name__ == “__main__”:

asyncio.run(main())

```

## Features

  • Async-first design - Built for Python 3.14+ with async/await

  • Modern Python features - Uses latest Python 3.14 features like TaskGroup and pattern matching

  • Type safety - Full type hints and validation with Pydantic

  • Automatic retries - Built-in exponential backoff and retry logic

  • Structured logging - Comprehensive logging with context

  • WebSocket support - Real-time streaming of market data

  • Sync wrapper - Synchronous interface available for legacy code
